pr_title: CAMEL-14780 camel-undertow: Enhance SPI API for HttpHandler change

timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: @davsclaus this is not parameter which comes from configuration, it is just private variable that is used by component when SPI implementation is searched for. From my POV there should be annotation like @nometadata in tis case.
replies.author: JiriOndrusek

timeline.bodyText: Add setter so you can set this explicit
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: I can do it also this way, in that case please ignore my previous comment
replies.author: JiriOndrusek

timeline.bodyText: Only init if the security provider is null
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.bodyText: getter/setters should be plain, not these tricks. Instead when creating the endpoint in the component, then set the security provider on the endpoint correctly
timeline.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: ok, I'll do it, thanks for explanation
replies.author: JiriOndrusek

timeline.bodyText: See prev comment, getter/setter should be plain
timeline.author: davsclaus

timeline.message: CAMEL-14780 camel-undertow: UndertowSecurityProvider SPI API misses a method to change HttpHandler
CAMEL-14780 camel-undertow: UndertowSecurityProvider SPI API misses a method to change HttpHandler
